intro: Melicytus collinus, commonly known as the kahikatea or the New Zealand mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows on the branches of other trees, deriving some of its nutrients from its host. It plays an important ecological role in New Zealand's forests, contributing to biodiversity and providing habitat for various insects and birds. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a vulnerable species.
